intro: Thesium archeri, commonly known as the golden burr, is a flowering plant native to the south-western regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellowish-orange flowers that appear in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Thesium archeri is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with woody stems and small, leathery leaves. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
